•  Currently, only certain sectors located within the Wari jurisdiction of the Dhaka South City Corporation are designated as ‘lockdown/containment’ zones   Restrictions on Designated Lockdown/Containment Areas:   •	Pedestrian and vehicular movements controlled through secured entry/exit points.  •	Residents should remain within their homes except for emergencies or for essential needs.  •	No indoor dining services allowed. Delivery food service options are available.  •	Grocery stores and pharmacies will remain open.  •	Residents will be allowed to shop in bazaars only when necessary.  •	Residents must work from home.  •	Transportation will be suspended. Rickshaws, vans, taxis, auto-rickshaws, and private vehicles are not permitted inside the demarcated areas during the 21-day lockdown.  •	COVID-19 tests will be available to residents, and home isolation or institutional isolation will be arranged for patients who test positive.  •	Shopping malls, gyms, sports complexes and recreation centers will be closed.  •	No public gatherings of any kind are allowed.  •	Only people who are ill may go to hospitals.  •	Mosques and other places of worship are closed to residents. Only official staff are permitted to enter.  •	ATM services will remain open. Banks will operate in a limited capacity.  •	Factories in towns will remain closed, but factories and agricultural production-related factories in rural areas can remain operational.  •	Agricultural work must be performed under strict health and hygiene regulations.  https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://bd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

Bangladesh authorities have said passengers arriving from coronavirus-affected countries, including the UK, should complete Health Declaration Forms and Passenger Locator Forms provided by cabin crew. You may be subjected to additional health screening measures at the airport.  On arrival in Bangladesh, all foreign nationals need to produce a medical certificate issued within 72 hours of travel indicating the passenger is COVID-19 negative. You should not use the NHS testing service to get a test in order to facilitate your travel to another country. You should arrange to take a private test.  If international travelers arrive in Bangladesh with COVID-19 symptoms, they will be institutionally quarantined for 14 days.   If international travelers arrive in Bangladesh with no COVID-19 symptoms, they will be required to “home quarantine” for 14 days.  https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://bd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  https://web.archive.org/web/2020*/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/bangladesh/entry-requirements

As of July 23, 2020, the Government of Bangladesh will take legal action against those not wearing masks or social distancing. Since May 30, the Government of Bangladesh has made wearing masks and social distancing mandatory when outside the home. Public administrators in Khulna Division have instituted a fine of TK 4,000 for those not adhering to this order.  https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://bd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

Schools are fully open according to government announcement since Feb. 1st  https://web.archive.org/web/20210316101901/https://www.gov.bt/covid19/29-01-21-press-release-on-unlocking-thimphu-and-beyond-starting-monday-february-1-2021-pmo/  According to the UNESCO website, schools are partially open, but no detail can be found.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210316100715/https://en.unesco.org/covid19/educationresponse

No change.   Students across the country returned to school beginning February, especially students of Classes PP-VIII. Students of classes IX-XII will start returning to schools in April since classes X and XII had their board examinations in March.  It appears therefore that the actual return to school has been staggered by agegroup despite the formal announcements of the government.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210330085548/https://kuenselonline.com/students-excited-to-be-back-at-school/

Several categories of recreational venues, such as movie theaters, dance clubs, and nightclubs, remain closed nationwide.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210316103145/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/452441/bhutan-authorities-maintain-domestic-covid-19-restrictions-travel-controls-as-of-march-8-update-23  In Thimphu, all shops, restaurants and business entities can open.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210316101901/https://www.gov.bt/covid19/29-01-21-press-release-on-unlocking-thimphu-and-beyond-starting-monday-february-1-2021-pmo/

Gatherings for religious purposes are discouraged, prompted by the fact that countries have experienced outbreaks from such events.     Gathering at any social events like birthday, wedding or promotion are disallowed.     Picnics or similar outdoor functions are prohibited.    All congregations at work, official dinners, functions or gatherings at workplace eateries are discouraged.   http://web.archive.org/web/20210330091444/https://kuenselonline.com/press-release-from-prime-ministers-office/

In Thimphu, essential gatherings of no more than 25 people are allowed provided the organizer obtains advance approval from authorities. All sporting activities are allowed but without any spectators.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210316103145/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/452441/bhutan-authorities-maintain-domestic-covid-19-restrictions-travel-controls-as-of-march-8-update-23  https://web.archive.org/web/20210316101901/https://www.gov.bt/covid19/29-01-21-press-release-on-unlocking-thimphu-and-beyond-starting-monday-february-1-2021-pmo/

Bhutanese authorities continue to ban the entry of foreign nationals.   All returnees from abroad are required to undergo a 21-day quarantine. Authorities are advising citizens against nonessential travel. Bhutanese nationals are required to register with the Department of Immigration before traveling abroad.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210316103145/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/452441/bhutan-authorities-maintain-domestic-covid-19-restrictions-travel-controls-as-of-march-8-update-23

Bhutanese travelling abroad must seek prior approval from Ministry of Foreign Affairs even before they start processing formalities for the travel.  Bhutan’s borders are currently closed to foreign nationals. The Royal Government of Bhutan has not yet specified when the country will re-open to foreign visitors.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210330091444/https://kuenselonline.com/press-release-from-prime-ministers-office/  http://web.archive.org/web/20210330092059/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/bhutan/entry-requirements

The government announced a National Resilience Fund for mitigating COVID-19 linked to job losses and salary cuts. The support included grant for individuals directly affected by the pandemic and full interest waiver on loans contracted since April 10, 2020 until June 2020. These measures were extended until September 2020, and partial (50 percent) interest waiver will continue until March 2021.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210222014756/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

Student in higher secondary/secondary grades continue to be allowed back in school in some states, while other states are going back in lockdown. Ministry of Home Affairs' order issued 27 Jan 2021 on ""Containment and Surveillance"" has been extended until 31 Mar 2021. States are allowed to enforce any restrictions over and above basic social distancing standards (eg 50% capacity on all indoor venues). This can include restriction of movement except for essential services. Due to the leeway given to states to decide level of restriction, this is coded as 3T.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210319163559/https://www.mha.gov.in/sites/default/files/MHAorderdt_27012021.pdf

A number of states have introduced weekend and night curfews, and restrictions on movements outside the home to only essential trips.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210404142306/https://www.financialexpress.com/lifestyle/health/covid-19-lockdown-new-live-updates-coronavirus-lockdown-india-march-30-live-news-india-state-lockdowns-latest-maharashtra-tamil-nadu-punjab-delhi-up-karnataka-corona-live-covid-vaccines-night-curfew-d/2222872/

Only government sanctioned flights under the ""Vande Bharat"" programme (including established air bubbles with select countries). Visas remain suspended.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210319164410/https://boi.gov.in/content/advisory-travel-and-visa-restrictions-related-covid-19-1

""All regularly scheduled international flights remain suspended. ""     https://web.archive.org/web/20210404143057/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/india/coronavirus
Loan repayments and evictions have been stayed until the next fiscal year  https://web.archive.org/web/20210319170132/https://rbi.org.in/scripts/BS_ViewBulletin.aspx?Id=20079

The Reserve Bank of India first announced a 3 month debt moratorium, extended a second time until August 2020. Most recently in February 2021, the debt moratorium and interest rates were stayed in light of the emerging macroeconomic situation, but no information has been shared for after the end of the financial year as of 31 March 2021.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210404135300/https://home.kpmg/xx/en/home/insights/2020/04/india-tax-developments-in-response-to-covid-19.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20210404134858/https://rbi.org.in/scripts/BS_ViewBulletin.aspx?Id=20079    https://web.archive.org/web/20210404134621/https://www.cgap.org/research/covid-19-briefing/debt-relief-pandemic-lessons-india-peru-and-uganda

Debt moratorium announced by the RBI last year was extended until 31 March 2021. No additional measures or continues policy announced since.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210404135300/https://home.kpmg/xx/en/home/insights/2020/04/india-tax-developments-in-response-to-covid-19.html

Since the start of vaccine campaign in Sri Lanka, made possible by the gifting of vaccines by India, 500,000 citizens have been vaccinated with the 'Made in India' COVISHIELD vaccine. The vaccine was given to key workers. Since the arrival of the next 500,000 doses (also COVISHEILD) on 25th February, the vaccine has now been rolled out into public where citizens above the age of 30 are receiving the jab. This has been focused in the Western Province primarily given that this is a current 'hotspot' for the country. (no availability of updated information regarding which specific groups are now currently getting the vaccine)     Source: https://web.archive.org/save/http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/asiapacific/2021-03/02/c_139778159.htm

The districts subject to the closures include 10 regions in the central province of Punjab and eight regions in northwestern Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province. The capital Islamabad is also subject to closures.    https://web.archive.org/20210404165230/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2021/3/25/pakistan-extends-school-closures-amid-coronavirus-third-wave

Pakistan has imposed a ban on gatherings including wedding ceremonies in cities and districts where the COVID-19 test positive rate is above 8 per cent, as a part of new restrictions to contain the third wave of coronavirus. The ban will be effective from April     https://web.archive.org/web/20210404171630/https://www.business-standard.com/article/current-affairs/pakistan-bans-gatherings-in-covid-19-hotspots-to-counter-third-wave-121032900060_1.html
